2. medipy.io — Reading and writing data¶

The following sub-modules are also documented :

  • 2.1. medipy.io.dicom — Basic and file functionalities of DICOM
    • 2.1.1. medipy.io.dicom.dictionary — DICOM dictionaries
    • 2.1.2. medipy.io.dicom.encapsulated_document — Storage of non-DICOM data in DICOM data sets
    • 2.1.3. medipy.io.dicom.routing — Rule-based modification and storage of data sets
  • 2.2. medipy.io.schemes
    • 2.2.1. medipy.io.schemes.dicom
    • 2.2.2. medipy.io.schemes.dicomdir
    • 2.2.3. medipy.io.schemes.dicom_series
    • 2.2.4. medipy.io.schemes.file
medipy.io.load(url, dtype=<type 'numpy.float32'>)¶

Load an image.

  • url : url to load from, uses the usual syntax of [scheme "://"] [authority] path [ "#" fragment]
  • dtype : type to which the data will be cast. Passing None will not cast.

The URL scheme can be one of :

  • file : load the image from the filesystem.
  • dicomdir : load an image using a DICOMDIR
  • dicom : load an image using a local filesystem directory containing DICOM files
  • dicom-series : load an image using a dicom_series file

Refer to the documentation of the different schemes for the details of the URL syntax.

If no scheme is specified, the URL is assumed to be a filesystem path.

medipy.io.load_serie(url, dtype=<type 'numpy.float32'>)¶

Load a serie of images.

  • url : url to load from.
  • dtype : type to which the data will be cast. Passing None will not cast.

See load() for URL details.

medipy.io.save(image, url)¶

Save an image.

  • image : image to save.
  • url : url to save to.

See load() for URL details.

medipy.io.save_serie(images, url)¶

Save a serie of images.

  • image : image to save.
  • url : url to save to.

See load() for URL details.

medipy.io.number_of_images(url)¶

Return the number of images contained at given URL

class medipy.io.IOBase(filename=None, report_progress=None)¶

Base class for all IO classes.

filename¶

Path to the file to read or write.
